New Records: Gerrit Cole pitched seven innings, allowing just one run, with six hits and four strikeouts.
The New York Yankees' bullpen extended their scoreless streak to 15 2/3 innings in the postseason.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe tagged Maikel Garcia at second base, completing a double play and sparking tension between the teams.
Giancarlo Stanton's single extended the lead to 3-0 in the sixth inning.
A near fracas occurred after a hard tag by Volpe, leading to players spilling out of dugouts.
Pre-Game Insights: Yankees manager Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of the bullpen's performance.
The Yankees' strong road performance was noted, with 50 wins away from home in the regular season.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge secured the final out and expressed pride in the team's resilience.
Royals manager Matt Quatraro reflected on the team's effort and the challenges of the playoff run.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals had not won a home game since September 8, ending a long win streak.
The Yankees' ability to win on the road was highlighted as a key factor.
Others: The game marked the Royals' first postseason appearance since 2015 and their first playoff series win in eight years.
